review: I have a Roku 3 streaming box for my big living room TV and wanted something for my bedroom when I moved to a new apartment that didn't have cable TV. I have most of the big streaming services: Hulu Plus, Netflix, Amazon Prime, and HBO GO.I was between this and the Roku streaming stick for the bedroom, and I decided to go with this because I had recently bought a kindle fire. While this is a perfectly functional device for streaming I am sort of left wishing I had gone with the Roku. The menus and navigation are awkward. Also with services such as HBO GO and Hulu Plus that post new episodes of shows, I've found myself having to frequently restart the device to get the new episodes to show up.The voice search on the app is nice, but the touch screen part is very difficult to use. simple arrows would be better.On the positive side: I haven't had many issues with buffering and have been able to watch all my shows without a problem. The second screen thing with the Kindle Fire X-ray feature is kind of cool too if you're the kind of person who likes to look up actors and fun facts on IMDB.Bottom line- a very functional device that serves it's purpose, however when it is time to replace I will probably look to another brand.
author: Evelyn Curtis
